articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Europe will invest more in security and lead on providing guarantees to Kyiv, but cooperation with Washington to secure peace remains crucial, European leaders said after an emergency meeting held ahead of U.S.-Russia talks on Ukraine.
articles.title: Europe says it is committed to Ukraine ahead of Russia-US talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A plane crashed at Toronto Pearson International Airport on Monday, officials said, with CBC television reporting the plane flipped on landing.
articles.title: Delta plane flips on landing at Toronto airport, injuring 8

articles.author: Joyce Lee, Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: North Korea's foreign ministry said on Tuesday that it will keep bolstering its nuclear force, denouncing a recent joint pledge by the United States, South Korea and Japan for its denuclearisation, according to state media KCNA.
articles.title: North Korea denounces 'absurd' denuclearisation pledge by US and allies

articles.author: Ju-Min Park
articles.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol could try to impose martial law again or undermine constitutional institutions should he be reinstated, lawyers for parliament argued on Tuesday as his impeachment trial entered its final phase.
articles.title: South Korea's parliament presses for Yoon's removal as impeachment trial winds down

articles.author: George Hay, Yun Chee Foo
articles.description: The EU's competition chief says U.S. President Donald Trump has upended the "trustful relationship" between the United States and Europe, and that Brussels should focus on providing the predictability and stability that is lacking in Washington.
articles.title: Exclusive: EU antitrust chief says Trump has upended Europe-US relations

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Rwanda-backed rebel group is trying to show it can administer the cities of Goma and Bukavu.
articles.title: Rebel-held ports in eastern DR Congo re-open as aid needs grow

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin said on Tuesday that Russian President Vladimir Putin was serious about negotiating a settlement to end the war in Ukraine as high-level talks began in Saudi Arabia, and that Russia would prefer to achieve all its aims peacefully.
articles.title: Putin is serious about negotiating peace in Ukraine, Kremlin says

articles.author: Francesco Guarascio, Phuong Nguyen
articles.description: Vietnam plans to adopt rules that would allow Elon Musk's Starlink to provide satellite internet services in the country while maintaining full ownership of any local subsidiary, a draft of the regulations shows.
articles.title: Vietnam paves way for Musk's Starlink, seen as "olive branch" amid US tariff threats

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An higher proportion of foreigners in Germany does not lead to a higher crime rate, a research institute said on Tuesday, five days ahead of an election in which violent attacks linked to migrants have pushed security to the top of the agenda.
articles.title: Higher proportion of migrants does not mean more crime, German institute says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkish police detained 282 suspected members of the Kurdistan Workers Party, or PKK, militant group in raids over the last five days, Interior Minister Ali Yerlikaya said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Turkish police detain 282 suspects in raids targeting PKK militants
